definitions.definition: a flowering plant's unit of reproduction, capable of developing into another such plant.
examples: pip, stone, kernel; ovule apple seeds

definitions.definition: the cause or latent beginning of a feeling, process, or condition.
examples: the conversation sowed a tiny seed of doubt in his mind
synonyms: grounds "each war contains within it the seeds of a fresh war"

definitions.definition: (chiefly in biblical use) a person's offspring or descendants.
examples: descendants, heirs, successors, scions; Moreoffspring, children, sons and daughters, progeny, family; issue; derogatoryspawn; archaicfruit of someone's loins "Abraham and his seed"Moreoffspring, children, sons and daughters, progeny, family; issue; spawn; fruit of someone's loins Abraham and his seed

definitions.definition: a small crystal introduced into a liquid to act as a nucleus for crystallization.
examples: noun: seed crystal; plural noun: seed crystals

definitions.definition: a small container for radioactive material placed in body tissue during radiotherapy.

any of a number of stronger competitors in a sports tournament who have been assigned a specified position in an ordered list with the aim of ensuring that they do not play each other in the early rounds.
examples: he knocked the top seed out of the championships
the shoreline is seeded with a special grass

definitions.definition: sow (a particular kind of seed) on or in the ground.
cause (something) to begin to develop or grow.
examples: severance payouts that help seed their new businesses

definitions.definition: place a crystal or crystalline substance in (something) in order to cause crystallization or condensation (especially in a cloud to produce rain).
(of a plant) produce or drop seeds.
examples: mulches encourage many plants to seed freely

definitions.definition: (of a plant) reproduce itself by means of its own seeds.
remove the seeds from (vegetables or fruit).
give (a competitor) the status of seed in a tournament.
examples: Jeff Tarango, seeded five, was defeated by fellow American Todd Witsken
